intro: Siphonanthus conglobatus, commonly known as the globular siphonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive globular shape and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Siphonanthus conglobatus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
